context: The Estonian word 'korras' has multiple meanings depending on context. It can refer to a system or arrangement (social order), rules and regulations (established order), a proper condition (good shape/orderliness), or as an adverb meaning properly/in order. As an adjective, it describes something that is well-arranged or in good condition. When used alone as an interjection, it means 'Okay' or 'Alright'. The word can be used both attributively and predicatively.
